parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or created during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject had any surgical, therapeutic or diagnostic procedures. If "Yes", include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the subject had any procedures performed.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Procedures Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: PRYN
fields.questionText: Were any surgical, therapeutic or diagnostic procedures performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the procedure category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category of Procedure
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the procedure?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the procedure subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the PRCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. PRSCAT can only be used if there is a PRCAT and it must be a subcategorization of PRCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory of Procedure
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the procedure?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile procedure records with medical history and/or with AEs. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Procedure Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: PRSPID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRTRT

fields.completionInstructions: Record only one procedure per line.
fields.definition: The verbatim surgical, therapeutic or diagnostic procedures' name.
fields.implementationNotes: In most cases, the verbatim procedure names or therapy will be coded to a standard dictionary such as MedDRA or SNOMED after the data have been collected on the CRF.
fields.label: Procedure Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRTRT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRDECOD

fields.definition: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of PRTRT, or the modified topic variable (PRMODIFY), if applicable.
fields.implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the procedure, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process. If PRPRESP is used, and the information about a specific standardized procedure name is being solicited, the data from PRTRT may map directly to the SDTMIG PRDECOD variable.
fields.label: Procedure Dictionary or Standardized Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRDECOD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRMODIFY

fields.definition: If the value for PRTERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
fields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the procedure, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process.
fields.label: Modified Procedure Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRMODIFY

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRPRESP

fields.definition: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is pre-specified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: For pre-specified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to Y, or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified interventions as well as free-text interventions, the value of --PRESP should be Y for all pre-specified interventions and null for interventions reported as free-text.
fields.label: Pre-Specified Procedure
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PROCCUR

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if [specific procedure] was performed by checking Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication whether a pre-specified procedure (PRTRT) happened when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: PROCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a pre-specific procedures. PROCCUR is not used for spontaneously free text reported procedures. The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Procedure Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". If the response was not asked or answered, populate the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT with "NOT DONE".
fields.name: PROCCUR
fields.questionText: Was [PRTRT] performed?; Has the subject had [PRTRT]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRREASOC

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate why the procedure was not performed.
fields.definition: An explanation of why a scheduled procedure did not occur.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the scheduled procedure was not performed may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., SUBJECT REFUSED, etc.) or entered as free text. When --REASOC is used, --OCCUR must also be populated in the SDTM dataset with a value of "N".
fields.label: Procedure Reason for Occur Value
fields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRREASOC" and SUPPPR.QLABEL ="Reason for Occur Value". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PRREASOC
fields.questionText: What was the reason that the procedure was not performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRCSTAT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the procedure data was not collected.
fields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording a sponsor-defined value (e.g., Not Collected/Not Evaluated/Not Assessed/Not Available/Not Answered)
fields.implementationNotes: A check box used to indicate that data collection was "Not Collected". It cannot be used to indicate that a procedure was not done. This variable may only be populated if PROCCUR is null.
fields.label: Procedure Collected Completion Status
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT is populated by mapping the value of the CDASH variable PRCSTAT "NOT COLLECTED" to "NOT DONE".
fields.name: PRCSTAT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why the procedure was not done.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (or example, broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When PRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset. The value "NOT DONE" here indicates that the subject was not questioned/data was not collected. It does not mean that the subject did not have the procedure.
fields.label: Procedure Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason not done?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRPRIOR

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check if the procedure was started before the specified point in time.
fields.definition: Indication the procedure occurred prior to [PRSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.
fields.implementationNotes: See section on Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions and the SDTMIG for more information.
fields.label: Prior Procedure
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as PRSTRF or PRSTRTPT. When populating PRSTRF, or PRSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field PRPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When PRPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable PRSTRF should be populated. When PRPRIOR is compared to any other time point, the SDTM variables PRSTRTPT and PRSTTPT should be used. Note: PRSTRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in PRSTTPT.
fields.name: PRPRIOR
fields.questionText: Was the procedure performed prior to [PRSTTPT]?; Was the procedure performed prior to study start?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date the procedure was started or performed using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). Procedures performed during the study are expected to have a complete start date. Prior procedures that are exclusionary should have both a start and end date.
fields.definition: The date or start date of when the procedure started or was performed represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The preferred method is to collect a complete Start Date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only) for procedures started a considerable amount of time prior to the start of study are acceptable.
fields.label: Procedure Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PRSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PRSTDAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check the box if the procedure has not ended at the time of data collection and the end date should be left blank.
fields.definition: Indication the procedure is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the procedure has not stopped at the time of data collection. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring, since this field provides further confirmation that the End Date was deliberately left blank. Reference section 2.1.3 for more information about collecting relative date/time and see section 4.1.4 of the SDTMIG V. 3.2 for information about mapping relative times.
fields.label: Ongoing Procedure
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as PRENRF or PRENRTPT. When populating PRENRF, if the value of PRONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating PRENRTPT, if the value of PRONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When PRONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable PRENRF should be populated. When PRONGO is used in conjunction with any other time point, the SDTM variables PRENRTPT and PRENTPT should be used. Note: PRENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in PRENTPT.
fields.name: PRONGO

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date of the procedure using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the procedure has not ended, leave this field blank and populate PRONGO as "Y".
fields.definition: The end date of the procedure represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The assumption is that sponsors should either have an End Date or will indicate that the procedure was ongoing at the time of collection or at the end of the study. However, in cases where the End Date can be determined from dates collected elsewhere in the CRF it is not necessary to include an End Date in the CRF. For example, if the procedure is started and stopped within the same day, the End Date will be the same as the Start Date.
fields.label: Procedure End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable PRENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PRENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the procedure end date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRINDC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the reason the procedure was performed based on clinical investigator's evaluation. If performed to treat a condition, and a diagnosis was made, the indication should be the diagnosis. If performed to treat a condition, and no diagnosis was made, the indication should be the signs and symptoms. If taken as prophylaxis, report as "Prophylaxis for " and include a description of the condition(s).
fields.definition: The condition, disease, symptom or disorder that the procedure was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered or the procedure performed).
fields.implementationNotes: This additional information is collected on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture the reason(s) why a procedure was performed. This information can then be used as deemed appropriate for coding, analysis (e.g., in the classification of procedures), for reconciling the procedures performed on a subject with their provided medical history and/or AEs/SAEs as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process, etc.
fields.label: Procedure Indication
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRINDC
fields.questionText: For what indication, was the [PRTRT] performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRAENO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier of the adverse event for which this procedure was performed.
fields.definition: Identifier for the adverse event that is the indication for this procedure.
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the adverse event and the procedure performed for the adverse event. PRAENO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the PR dataset and records in the AE dataset. See section 8.2 in the SDTMIG V3.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Related Adverse Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Adverse Events domain.
fields.name: PRAENO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) for which the procedure was performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRMHNO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier of the medical history event for which this procedure was performed.
fields.definition: Identifier for the medical history event that is the indication for this procedure.
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the medical history condition and the procedure undergone for the medical history condition. PRMHNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the PR dataset and records in the MH dataset. See section 8.2 in the SDTMIG V3.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Related Medical History Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Medical History domain.
fields.name: PRMHNO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the medical history event(s) for which the procedure was performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRDSTXT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [dose/amount] of [PRTRT] per administered.
fields.definition: The dose/amount administered during the procedure.
fields.implementationNotes: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text or ranges. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either SDTMIG PRDOSE if numeric or PRDOSTXT if text.
fields.label: Procedure Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to PRDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to PRDOSTXT in SDTM.
fields.name: PRDSTXT
fields.questionText: What was the [dose/amount] of [PRTRT] (per administration/for the procedure)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRDOSU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit for the amount of [PRTRT] performed or administered.
fields.definition: The unit for intended dose/amount for PRDOSE, PRDOSTOT, or PRDOSTXT.
fields.implementationNotes: When sponsors collect data for amount of [PRTRT] performed or administered, Unit should be collected as well (if applicable).
fields.label: Procedure Dose Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRDOSU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRDOSFRQ

fields.completionInstructions: Record how often the procedure was performed.
fields.definition: The number/amount of the procedure that was given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options. Usually expressed as the number of procedures given per a specific interval.
fields.label: Procedure Frequency per Interval
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRDOSFRQ

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRROUTE

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the route of administration for the procedure.
fields.definition: The route of administration of the procedure.
fields.implementationNotes: This additional information may be important to collect on the CRF when the sponsor would want to capture a procedure's route of administration for comparative analysis purposes.
fields.label: Procedure Route of Administration
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRROUTE
fields.questionText: What was the route of administration of the procedure?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the body location where the procedure was performed.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of an procedure, such as an location of Biopsy.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Example: Liver for the Biopsy. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Procedure Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location where the procedure was performed?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location where the procedure was administered.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing side of the body for the procedure administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the laterality of the location where the procedure was administered/taken. This may be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Procedure Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the administration?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the direction of the anatomical location where the procedure was administered.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Procedure Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the procedure?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRPORTOT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the portion of the body location that was treated.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Procedure Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRPORTOT
fields.questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location that was treated?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRFAST

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the procedure being performed.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: This information is collected when the procedure may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all procedures.
fields.label: Procedure Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRFAST

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRDOSRGM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the intended regimen for the procedure to be performed.
fields.definition: The text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the procedure.
fields.implementationNotes: The regimen information may further clarify the dose administration and dose frequency (e.g., TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF). This may be pre-specified or collected. The sponsor may wish to create a codelist to collect this data consistently.
fields.label: Intended Procedure Regimen
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRDOSRGM
fields.questionText: What was the intended procedure regimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRDOSADJ

fields.completionInstructions: Record if the procedure was adjusted from planned.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the procedure dose/amount was adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (PRADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the procedure dose/amount was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change.
fields.label: Procedure Adjusted
fields.mappingInstructions: When PRADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When PRADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable as a SUPPQ.
fields.name: PRDOSADJ

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRADJ

fields.completionInstructions: Record why the procedure dose was adjusted from planned.
fields.definition: Description or explanation of why a procedure dose/amount was adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Captures reason [PRTRT] dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (for example, adverse event, insufficient response, etc.) or entered as free text.
fields.label: Reason for Procedure Adjustment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: PRADJ
fields.questionText: What was the reason the procedure dose was adjusted?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRTRTCMP

fields.completionInstructions: Record if the subject completed the intended regimen.
fields.definition: Indication whether the subject completed the intended regimen.
fields.implementationNotes: Depending on how the [PTTRT] dose details are collected via the CRF/eCRF, it may be possible to derive those data if the regimen data are collected.
fields.label: Completed Procedure
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRTRTCMP" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Treatment Completed". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PRTRTCMP
fields.questionText: Did the subject complete the full course of the [PRTRT]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRITRPYN

fields.completionInstructions: Record if the procedure was interrupted.
fields.definition: An indication whether the procedure was interrupted.
fields.implementationNotes: Provides a definitive response regarding any procedure interruption. The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring when the duration of the interruption is collected. In some situations, if the actual duration of the interruption is not collected, or not derived, this information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset.
fields.label: Procedure Interrupted
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: PRITRPYN

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRITRPRS

fields.completionInstructions: Record the reason the procedure was interrupted.
fields.definition: An indication why the intervention was interrupted.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH field is use to collected the reason why an intervention was interrupted. The sponsor may define their own controlled terminology.
fields.label: Reason Procedure Interrupted
fields.mappingInstructions: his information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRITRPRS" and SUPPPR.QLABEL ="Reason Intervention Interrupted". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PRITRPRS

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRITRPD

fields.completionInstructions: Record how long the procedure was interrupted before it resumed.
fields.definition: The duration of the procedure interruption as collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This field is used to collect the duration of procedure interruption. In some situations, the duration of the interruption may not be collected but calculated from the procedure start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF. This derived variable is not included in an SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Procedure Interruption Duration
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. Concatenate the CDASH fields for collected PRTRT interruption duration and the unit components and create PRITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. The information could be submitted in an SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRITRPD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL = "Collected Interruption Duration". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PRITRPD
fields.questionText: What was the duration of the procedure interruption?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRITRPDU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit for the duration of interruption of the procedure.
fields.definition: The unit for the duration of the procedure interruption.
fields.implementationNotes: The unit should be collected as a qualifier to the number for duration.
fields.label: Procedure Interruption Duration Units
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. Concatenate the CDASH fields for collected PRTRT interruption duration and the unit components and create PRITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. The information could be submitted in an SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRITRPD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL = "Collected Interruption Duration". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PRITRPDU
fields.questionText: What was the interruption duration unit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field PR.PRLLT

fields.definition: MedDRA Dictionary text description of the Lowest Level Term.
fields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete Data Management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for coding. Another dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.
fields.label: Procedure Lowest Level Term
fields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRLLT" and SUPPPR.QLABEL ="Lower Level Term". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
fields.name: PRLLT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0
